definition-item.definition-title: CRIMPING OR CURLING FIBRES, FILAMENTS, THREADS, OR YARNS; YARNS OR THREADS

section-body.paragraph-text: The post treatment of fibres and filaments (usually synthetic) to give them a structure more like natural fibres i.e. crimped or curled to make them easier to work with during further processing.
D02G3/00 covers the making of yarns or threads, e.g. fancy yarns; processes or apparatus for the production. D02G concerns treatments before this stage.

table-column.paragraph-text: Yarns or threads, e.g. fancy yarns; Processes or apparatus for the productionthereof
Unwinding, paying-out, forwarding, winding or coilingfilamentary material not intimately associated with spinning or twisting
Cores, formers, supports or holders for coiled or wound material, e.g. bobbins
Mechanical methods or apparatus in the manufacture of artificial filaments, threads, fibres, bristles, or ribbons
Chemical features in the manufacture of artificial filaments, threads, fibres, bristles, or ribbons; apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture of carbon filaments
Twisting oakum
Spinning or twisting
Making chenille
General aspects of chemical treatment
Testing yarns, rovings, slivers, fibres, or fibre webs

section-body.paragraph-text: The "common rule" applies in each of the subgroups
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fibre
a relatively-short, elongated member of natural or artificial material.
Filament
an endless or quasi-endless, elongated member of natural or artificial material.
Yarn
a unitary assembly of fibres, usually produced by spinning.
Thread
an assembly of yarns or filaments, usually produced by twisting.
False twisting
synthetic filaments are twisted, heat set while twisted and then untwisted to form a crimp
Texturing or texturizing
curling and crimping
Stuffer box
a confined space where yarns or filaments are compressed and deformed

definition-item.definition-title: Yarns or threads, e.g. fancy yarns; Processes or apparatus for the production thereof, not otherwise provided for (for producing crimped or curled yarns D02G1/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Yarns or threads characterised by the material or by the materials from which they are made. These aspects are covered by D02G3/02.
Yarns or threads characterised by constructional features. These aspects are covered by D02G3/22.
Yarns or threads characterised by the purpose for which they are designed. These aspects are covered by D02G3/44.

table-column.paragraph-text: Shoe laces
Dental floss
Warp knitted yarns
Braided cords, lines or tows
Ropes and strands for ropes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wearing apparel
A41B - A41G
Selection of special materials for outerwear
Woven materials characterised by the material or construction of the yarn
Weft knitting processes characterised primarily by the use of particular thread materials
Warp knitting processes characterised by the incorporation by knitting, in one or more thread, fleece, or fabric layers, of reinforcing, binding, or decorative threads

section-body.paragraph-text: In this main group, further classification in indexing scheme D10B for aspects relating to yarns is required.

definition-item.definition-title: Yarns or threads characterised by the material or by the materials from which they are made

section-body.paragraph-text: The classification is desirably complemented by a classification in the indexing scheme D10B2101/00 - D10B2331/301 for identifying the thread composition.

definition-item.definition-title: {all components being made from artificial or synthetic material}

section-body.paragraph-text: Blended or other yarns or threads containing components including aramid fibres and similar high performance fibres.

special-meanings.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: "Aromatic polyamide"
"aramid".
"Para aramid"
"terephthalamide (PPTA)".
"Meta aramid"
"poly-metaphenylene isophthalamide (MPIA)".
"Ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMWPE)"
"poly(p-phenylene-2,6-benzobisoxazole".

table-column.paragraph-text: Woven fabrics characterised by using paper threads

definition-item.definition-title: Threads containing metallic filaments or strips

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gloves made of wire-mesh
Resistance heating devices in seats specially adapted for vehicles
Woven fabrics characterised by the warp or weft elements being of stiff material, e.g. wire

definition-item.definition-title: Yarns or threads made from mineral substances

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Artificial filaments or the like of other substances, manufacture thereof, apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture of carbon filaments
Woven fabrics characterised by using threads comprising a mineral

section-body.paragraph-text: The classification is desirably complemented by a classification in the Indexing Codes D10B2101/00 - D10B2101/16 for identifying the thread composition.

definition-item.definition-title: from glass or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fibreglass strands extruded from spinnerets
Glass fibre or filament
Woven fabrics using glass fibres

definition-item.definition-title: Doubled, plied, or cabled threads {(D02G3/32, D02G3/36 take precedence; effect yarns D02G3/34; details of spindles, e.g. bearings D01H7/86)}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Doubled yarns

yarns consisting of two or more strands treated as one in the weaving process. The strands are not twisted together. The doubled yarn must not be confused with ply yarns, which are stronger because they are twisted.
Plied or folded yarns

yarns comprising two or more strands or yarns twisted together. They are termed two-ply, three-ply, and so on, according to the number used in their construction. Ply yarns are preferred where durability is all-important.
Cabled or cord yarns

yarns comprising two or more plied yarns twisted together. In general they are constructed by twisting the plied yarns around each other successively in the opposite direction of the preceding twist, i.e. S/Z/S or Z/S/Z. As a result, the opposite twist directions cause the plies to grip each other and maintain adherence. These yarns are hard, rough and strong.

definition-item.definition-title: {using one drawing frame for two slivers and twisting of the slivers to a single yarn, i.e. spin-twisting (guides having associated actuators with mutual action D01H13/1658)}
{using hollow spindles through which one yarn is running}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Multiple twist arrangements

definition-item.definition-title: {one yarn running over the feeding spool of another yarn}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spinning or twisting machines for imparting multiple twist, e.g. two-for-one twisting
Multiple twist arrangements

definition-item.definition-title: {with alternatively "S" and "Z" direction of twist, e.g. Self-twist process}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Self-twist yarn

yarn that comprises two or more strands that have areas of twist in what is known as the Z-direction and areas of twist in what is known as the S-direction. The twisted areas in the strands are each separated by non-twisted areas. Torque is trapped in the twisted strand and is otherwise known as residual twist. When two or more twisted strands are brought together, the torque or residual twist causes the strands to twist around each other naturally, without interference, to form a self twisted yarn.

definition-item.definition-title: {with same direction of twist, but with an amount of twist varying along the thread}
Crêped or other highly-twisted yarns or threads

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Crêped yarns or hard twist
yarns with a number of twist per unit of length higher than ordinary yarn.

definition-item.definition-title: Elastic yarns or threads {; Production of plied or cored yarns, one of which is elastic}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Woven fabrics using stretchable or elastic threads
Abrics or articles defined by weft knitting using elastic threads
Fabrics or articles defined by warp knitting incorporating elastic threads

definition-item.definition-title: {using hollow spindles (details of spindles, e.g. bearings D01H7/86)}
{using a drawing frame}

Yarns or threads having slubs, knops, spirals, loops, tufts, or other irregular or decorative effects, i.e. effect yarns {(carding machines for producing decorative or fancy effects in products D01G; drafting machines with varying draft according to a pre-arranged pattern D01H5/36)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Filamentary material with threaded or stringed pearls or beads

definition-item.definition-title: {with coloured effects, i.e. by differential dyeing process}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Woven fabrics characterised by using coloured threads
Passing of textile materials through liquids, gases or vapours to effect treatment of yarns, threads or filaments

definition-item.definition-title: Cored or coated yarns or threads ({D02G3/34, D02G3/40 take precedence}; elastic yarns or threads D02G3/32)

table-column.paragraph-text: Cored yarns or threads with an elastic core and/or sheath

definition-item.definition-title: {around which a reel supporting feeding spool rotates}

Threads in which fibres, filaments, or yarns are wound with other yarns or filaments, {e.g. wrap yarns, i.e. strands of filaments or staple fibres are wrapped by a helically wound binder yarn; (D02G3/32 takes precedence)}; (covering endless core threads with fibres by using open-end spinning techniques D01H4/00)
Yarns in which fibres are united by adhesives; Impregnated yarns or threads

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Passing of yarns, threads or filaments through liquids, gases or vapours to effect treatment

definition-item.definition-title: {Yarns or threads coated with polymeric solutions}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Modifying the surface of filaments, yarns or threads by treating with particulate, semi-solid, or solid substances

definition-item.definition-title: {where the polymeric solution is removable at a later stage, e.g. by washing}

section-body.paragraph-text: Yarns or threads coated with polymeric solutions removable at a later stage. The polymeric solution can also be in the form of a yarn, e.g. twisted or blended with other components of the yarn.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Woven fabrics using scaffolding threads, i.e. threads removed after weaving

definition-item.definition-title: Chenille threads

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chenille fabrics
Chenille trimmings

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chenille yarn

is manufactured by placing short lengths of yarn, called the "pile", between two core yarns and then twisting the yarn together. The edges of these piles then stand at right angles from the yarn's core, giving the chenille both its softness and its characteristic look. Chenille will look different in one direction compared to another, as the fibres catch the light differently.

definition-item.definition-title: Tyre cords {(tyre reinforcements B60C9/00; metal cords for reinforcing rubber or plastic articles D07B1/0606)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Textile tyre cords and hybrid tyre cords.

table-column.paragraph-text: Metal tyre cords

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcements or ply arrangement of pneumatic tyres
Driving belts made of fibrous material, e.g. textiles, whether rubber-covered or not

section-body.paragraph-text: Hybrid cords (i.e. comprising metal wires and filaments or yarns within the same rope or strand) have to be classified in both D02G3/48 and D07B1/0606 or lower hierarchy.
